page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY BUILDING.
page.content: Ribby Hall was not always a Leisure Village.A long time ago it was completely different.The reception used to be an old barn,and the Inn was some stables.At first the hall was owned by Mr.Duckworth,he used it as a private house.Then the army used it for office use,then it was bought and used as a school for the deaf and blind.Then it changed hands again and it was used for agricultural uses.Now Mr.Taylor owns it and it is divided into seperate flats.Mr.Taylor has plans for a Hotel,a swimming pool and a dry ski slope to be built onto the Hall.When Mr.Taylor came to the Hall there was an old barn all run down,and full of cats.He renovated it and now a family lives there.
